title: M. K. Muthu
text:
M. K. Muthu is an Indian actor, singer and politician. Muthu is the eldest son of late former <a href="Tamil%20Nadu">Tamil Nadu</a> chief minister <a href="M.%20Karunanidhi">M. Karunanidhi</a> and his first wife Padmavathi, sister of actor-singer Chidambaram S, Jayaraman. According to the internal evidence provided by Karunanidhi, in the 1st volume of his autobiography, Muthu's birth probably took place on January 14, 1948, Muthu's mother Padmavathi had died at the age of 20, soon after giving birth to Muthu, due to accelerated tuberculosis fever.
Muthu started acting in 1970 and appeared in films such as "<a href="Pillaiyo%20Pillai%20%28film%29">Pillaiyo Pillai</a>", "Samayalkaran", "Anayavilaku", "Ingeyum Manidhargal" and "<a href="Pookkari">Pookkari</a>". He also sang a few songs in these films. In 2008, he sang a song for the film "<a href="Mattuthavani%20%28film%29">Mattuthavani</a>" under music director <a href="Deva%20%28composer%29">Deva</a>. Most of his movies paired with actress <a href="Vennira%20Aadai%20Nirmala">Vennira Aadai Nirmala</a> are hit.
Career.
Karunanidhi initially had wanted Muthu to be his political heir in the early 1970s, but later launched him into films as a counter to M G Ramachandran, founder of the AIADMK. But Muthu's career in films never really took off.
Muthu later had difference of opinions with Karunanidhi and he went on to join his father's rival party AIADMK. However father and son patched up in 2009 after Muthu fell ill.
